summary: This document outlines a request from the Miami office of the FBI for scanning and automation assistance from the Document Conversion Laboratory in relation to an obstruction of justice case involving Alfredo Rodriguez, a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein. The document details the handling of telephone records believed to be connected to Epstein and potential victims.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Rodriguez is mentioned as the former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein, who was involved in an obstruction of justice case for attempting to sell an address book containing names of potential victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is referenced as the subject of a child prostitution case, with connections to the telephone records being investigated.

connections.description: Rodriguez was employed by Epstein as his house manager and butler.

events.title: Obstruction of Justice Case Opened
events.description: The Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez attempted to sell an address book containing names and telephone numbers of potential victims of Jeffrey Epstein.
The document discusses the handling of telephone records believed to belong to Epstein and his associates.
The Miami office is coordinating with the Document Conversion Laboratory for scanning and automation assistance related to the case.
